reviewText: Christian Walker presents a stunningly believable performance of a gay man, and being from Tennessee, Christian is aware of the prejudice that exists towards gays in the South. Those who rate this movie poorly do not understand the truth behind the story, and have never been to a gay pride march in Tennessee where there may only be 12 people in a small town parade. I love the movie for its entertainment value, and I thank the director and the producer for educating the country on Southern experience!
A wonderful story!  This is a cute happy tale of overcoming adversity. I love the plot and the family dynamics.
Fast service and item was as described.
I loved it! It was funny and heartfelt in all the right places without trying too hard. Perfect way to spend a lazy afternoon.
Not every gay-themed film has to be a masterpiece.  However, it also doesn't have to do such a disservice to the audience it was made for.  This one is a real stinker.
I appreciate the attempt, too bad it failed.

Whilst the story line held promise, you have to wait until the last 10 minutes for anything 'gay' to happen, and then it's a total let down.  Sad, sad film.  Don't waste your time and money.  Thank you, Amazon.
Acting could be better but it was funny
Refreshing take on LGBT and bigotry in conservative society.
No where near the quality I thought it would be when watching trailer.
Really?! This is one of the most poorly written and acted films I've ever encountered. 10 minutes and I'm out.
Will give it E for effort. Fun movie a bit underwhelming at points and kind of fell flat where it needed it most. But it is a fun script and the main characters are likable.
